hanzi-su-wiki:
絹

Значения

Шёлк

Мнемоника

Шелковичный червь, похожий на свернувшегося кружком 口 мясного 月. Его нитки 糸 используется для выделки особой ткани — шифона.

Варианты

绢

juàn
thin, tough silk fabric
тонкая, прочная шелковая ткань

絹絹RS
绢绢		kind of thick stiff silk, a handkerchief
  • worm 肙 producing a thread 糸
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 绢)
Pictophonetic: 肙 indicates the sound; 糹 (silk) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 絹網印花 [ juàn wǎng yìn huā ]: screen-printing (textiles)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 肙 [ yuàn ] a small worm; to twist; to surround; empty
heisig_constituent: silk, thread, spiderman, mouth, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
koohiiStory1: Silk threads are coming out of the caterpillar's mouth to cover its flesh while it transforms into a cocoon.
koohiiStory2: Spider-man loves to run his mouth all over Mary Jane´s silky flesh.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Put thread in the mouth of a worm while the moon is out and it will poop out some silk. That's why they call them silkworms, didn't you know? But it has to be while the moon is out, otherwise normal thread will come right back out the other end of the worm. The moon is what makes the magic happen.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture feeding some thread into the mouth of a worm as the light from the full moon shines in on you. See the silk come out of the worm's butt and into your hands.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The biggest fan of silk is Ken (けん) the samurai. Everything he wears is silk, even his armor.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Ken with a silk helmet, silk fundoshi, and a silk sheath for his sword.
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 月 (месяц), 糸 (нить)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the thread (糸) that would feed the mouth for a month (肙) is silk
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Spidey likes his threads to be made from a tough silk which won't stimulate his canker sores..
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "糸", "肙", the original meaning is silk fabric. "Shuowen": "Stained like a wheat noodle. From the 糸, the sound is awkward." "Mozi ‧Ciguo": "The treatment of silk and linen, cloth and silk, thought of folk clothing."

" Silk " can be combined with "罥", which means a net. "Zhou Li‧Qiuguan‧Yingshi": "Ying's palm attacks the fierce birds, and each uses its object as a medium to squeeze it." It also means entanglement. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Ma Rong Biography": "Silk hooves and shoulders." Li Xian's note: "Silk, Xiye, and Wutong."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "糸", "肙", the original meaning is silk fabric.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「肙」聲，本義為絲織物。《說文》：「繒如麥䅌。从糸，肙聲。」《墨子‧辭過》：「治絲麻，梱布絹，以為民衣。」

　　「絹」可通「罥」，表示羅網。《周禮‧秋官‧翨氏》：「翨氏掌攻猛鳥，各以其物為媒而掎之。」也表示纏繫。《後漢書‧馬融傳》：「絹猑蹄，鏦特肩。」李賢注：「絹，繫也，與罥通。」
humanum_short_description: 從「糸」，「肙」聲，本義為絲織物。

絹(きぬ): silk

從「 糸 」，「 肙 」聲，本義為絲織物。《說文》：「繒如麥䅌。从糸，肙聲。」《墨子‧辭過》：「治絲麻，梱布絹，以為民衣。」 「 絹 」可通「 罥 」，表示羅網。《周禮‧秋官‧翨氏》：「翨氏掌攻猛鳥，各以其物為媒而掎之。」也表示纏繫。《後漢書‧馬融傳》：「絹猑蹄，鏦特肩。」李賢注：「絹，繫也，與罥通。」
From the sound of " 糸", " 肙", the original meaning is silk fabric. "Shuowen": "Stained like a wheat noodle. From the 糸, the sound is awkward." "Mozi ‧Ciguo": "The treatment of silk and linen, cloth and silk, thought of folk clothing." " Silk" can be combined with " 罥", which means a net. "Zhou Li‧Qiuguan‧Yingshi": "Ying's palm attacks the fierce birds, and each uses its object as a medium to squeeze it." It also means entanglement. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Ma Rong Biography": "Silk hooves and shoulders." Li Xian's note: "Silk, Xiye, and Wutong."

絹字的基本解释

絹
juàn
见“绢”。

絹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［juàn］
［《廣韻》吉掾切，去線，見。］
“绢1”的繁体字。
(1)平纹的生丝织物，似缣而疏，挺括滑爽。
(2)今多指蚕丝及化纤的混纺织品。较缎、锦薄而坚韧。如天香绢、迎春绢等。
[②]［juàn］
［《集韻》古泫切，上銑，見。］
“绢2”的繁体字。通“罥1”。
(1)罗网。
(2)缠系。

絹字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　絹； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页924第21
【廣韻】【正韻】吉掾切【集韻】【韻會】規掾切，?音狷。【說文】繒如麥䅌。【博雅】䋷?鮮支縠絹也。【釋名】絹，䋌也，其絲䋌厚而疏也。【廣韻】縑也。　又【集韻】古泫切，音犬。罥，或作絹。【周禮·秋官·冥氏註】弧張罿罦之屬，所以扃絹禽獸。又【翨氏註】置其所食之物于絹中，鳥來，下則掎其足。　又【集韻】熒絹切，音炫。射侯綱紐。

考證：〔【博雅】繁繐鮮支縠絹也。〕　謹照原文繁改䋷。繐改?。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［juàn］
["Guang Yun" Ji Su cut, go to the line, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "織1".
(1) The plain-weave raw silk fabric is tangled and sparse, stiff and smooth.
(2) Nowadays, it mostly refers to the blended textiles of silk and chemical fiber. Satin and brocade are thin and tough. Such as Tianxiang silk, Yingchun silk and so on.
[②]［juàn］
["Ji Yun" ancient hyun cutting, milling, see. ]
The traditional characters of "織 2". Linked with "罥1".
(1) Drag the net.
(2) Entanglement.

Name meaning

juàn
вм. 绢
Radicals: 糸, 口, 月  (thread, mouth, moon)
Meaning Mnemonic
Put thread in the mouth of a worm while the moon is out and it will poop out some silk. That's why they call them silkworms, didn't you know? But it has to be while the moon is out, otherwise normal thread will come right back out the other end of the worm. The moon is what makes the magic happen.
Picture feeding some thread into the mouth of a worm as the light from the full moon shines in on you. See the silk come out of the worm's butt and into your hands.
Reading Mnemonic
The biggest fan of silk is Ken (けん) the samurai. Everything he wears is silk, even his armor.
Picture Ken with a silk helmet, silk fundoshi, and a silk sheath for his sword.
